heuristics.name: Visibility of System Status
heuristics.description: Keep users informed about what's happening through timely feedback

heuristics.name: Match Between System and the Real World
heuristics.description: Use familiar language, concepts, and conventions that users understand

heuristics.name: User Control and Freedom
heuristics.description: Provide ways to undo/redo actions and exit unwanted states easily

heuristics.name: Consistency and Standards
heuristics.description: Follow platform conventions and be consistent within your interface

heuristics.name: Error Prevention
heuristics.description: Prevent problems before they occur through good design

heuristics.name: Recognition Rather Than Recall
heuristics.description: Make objects, actions, and options visible; don't make users remember

heuristics.name: Flexibility and Efficiency of Use
heuristics.description: Provide shortcuts and ways to customize for experienced users

heuristics.name: Aesthetic and Minimalist Design
heuristics.description: Remove irrelevant or rarely needed information; keep it clean

heuristics.name: Help Users Recognize, Diagnose, and Recover from Errors
heuristics.description: Error messages should be clear, indicate the problem, and suggest solutions

heuristics.name: Help and Documentation
heuristics.description: Provide help documentation that is easy to find, searchable, and focused on user tasks

rubric.name: COGS 187A - Assignment 3 Autograder Rubric
rubric.description: Each submission is evaluated across core heuristic-evaluation criteria plus optional bonus sections.

criteria.title: Coverage
criteria.description: All 10 heuristics addressed with a minimum of 12 distinct violations.

criteria.title: Violation Quality
criteria.description: Clear explanations with realistic user scenarios and justified severity ratings.

criteria.title: Screenshots & Evidence
criteria.description: Well-annotated, high quality visual documentation for each violation.

criteria.title: Severity Analysis
criteria.description: Thoughtful severity ratings with a concise summary section.

criteria.title: Structure & Navigation
criteria.description: Submission organized into clear sections that are easy to follow.

criteria.title: Professional Quality
criteria.description: Consistent formatting, polished presentation, and overall craft.

criteria.title: Group Integration
criteria.description: Evidence of collaborative evaluation and synthesis.

bonusCriteria.title: Bonus: Optional AI Opportunities Section
bonusCriteria.description: Thoughtful discussion of how AI could improve UX, tied to violations and showing realistic understanding of AI capabilities/limitations.

bonusCriteria.title: Bonus: Exceptional Quality
bonusCriteria.description: Work significantly exceeds expectations; portfolio-quality insight, creativity, or thoroughness.
